I am only looking to get rid of it because my hands are massive and I can't consistently shoot this pistol well. These guys make some of the best practical gun leather out there and are a great company to support.  I have approximately 125 (or more) of ball 9mm ammo that will be included.  It comes with the original box, a 10 round, and a 17 round magazine.  The holster has never been carried and is brand new.  It goes for $80 and the magazine pouch is about $30 new.

title: For Sale:  Canik 55 Stingray-C Compact 9mm
postcontent:
READ THIS ... You must include your phone number with your inquiry, or I will not respond.

For sale is a like-new Canik 55 Stingray C compact 9mm pistol (about 300 rounds down the pipe, no failures), imported from Turkey by Century Arms International.  If you're looking for an ultra-light sub-compact pocket pistol, this is not the gun for you.  If you want a reliable, accurate, concealable pistol you can comfortably shoot all day, then read on.

The Stingray-C is patterned after the CZ P-01 Compact (not a true clone).  It is a robust all-steel construction, that employs a slide that rides inside the frame, for a lower center of mass and lower bore axis, with very manageable recoil.  It is a very well-made pistol, with well executed fit and finish, and no sloppy tool marks anywhere, inside or out.  The trigger is smooth in both DA and SA, with a nice clean break in SA.

It features ambidextrous manual safety and slide release, 3-dot sights, a Picatinney frame rail for lights or lasers, grip serrations on the frontstrap and backstrap, and on the front of the trigger guard, a prominent loaded-chamber indicator, and a 1911-style frame-mounted manual safety (up is safe, down is fire), with a firing pin safety that blocks the pin until the trigger is fully pulled.  You can engage the manual safety in any hammer position, and fire in DA mode from hammer down or half-cocked.  SA from full cock.  There is no de-cocker, but the hammer is easy to manipulate.  You can safely carry in cocked-and-locked, or hammer down on a loaded chamber.  There is no magazine disconnect safety.  

This pistol comes with two factory 15-round magazines, a 14-round CZ 75 Compact magazine (fits flush to bottom of grip), with after-market exotic hardwood grips.  It is 7.0 inches long, 5.0 inches high (5.25" with factory grips, see photos), with a 3.4" barrel.  The finish is a polycoat over black phosphate, and most internal parts are black-chrome plated for wear resistance.

Check the reviews online, they are all very positive.  The best you'd do buying new is about $315 (Bud's guns), plus FFL tran$fer, $10 background check, about $35 for the grips, and about $25 for the CZ magazine.

Cash only, FTF transaction, Wisconsin residents only, ID required.  No felons.  No kidding, I will check.  Nothing personal, I just don't need the legal hassles.

I travel often, so I may not reply immediately, but I will respond to your PHONE NUMBERS in the order in which they are received.

Adams Arm Gas Piston Rifle
The 5.56 Carbine Quad Rail 16" Upper is a standard M4 style upper that incorporates the patented Adams Arms technology. The piston system parts and the barrel have been treated with our salt nitride Meloniting process making them harder and more corrosive resistant than hard chrome. Add the patented Adams Arms piston system and you'll have an upper that will run cleaner, cooler, and longer than any other AR upper you own.

Specifications:

Upper Receiver: A4 Flat-Top. Billet

Barrel Length: 16"

Barrel Contour: Carbine M4

Barrel Material: Voodoo Chrome Moly Vanadium Steel
finished with our proprietary QPQ Melonite process inside and out. Unlike hard chrome and magnesium phosphate, Melonite is a molecular bonding process with the metal. It allows the chemicals to seep down below the surface area of the metal, instead of just adding a top layer. This means that the barrel can be cut to a true rifle bore while maintaining complete corrosion resistance and virtually no wear. It also means that the protection offered is not just a thin layer on top of the material but actually penetrates layers deep ensuring that it does not wear off. Now you have the velocities of a stainless steel true rifle bore with complete protection! You can out last a chrome lined barrel and shoot with the accuracy and efficiency of a stainless steel barrel, all without breaking the bank

Barrel Finish: QPQ Melonite / Black Nitride

Muzzle Thread Pattern: 1/2"-28

Twist Rate: 1 in 7"

title: For Trade:  Rare Unfired Arsenal SLR-95 Bulgarian Milled AK47
postcontent:
The SLR 95 is an all Bulgarian milled AK-47 which was last imported to the U.S. in 1998. The SLR-95 is regarded as among the best along with the SA-93 and SLR-96 because they were the only 100% Bulgarian made rifles ever imported. All other Arsenals have some U.S. component to them. These guns also have CHF Chrome-lines Steyr barrels, making them incredibly accurate. The SLR95 is outfitted with a 90 degree gas block and an AKM front end.

These guns are rare, but what puts this one on an entirely different level is that it is unfired. Made in 1997, this gun has managed to spend nearly 20 years unfired and occasionally cleaned so that it maintains its collectors value.

Sling, cleaning kit, and oil can all still in factory packaging. Original box, manual, and magazine included. One of a kind offer. Thanks for looking!

A hard-anodized 30mm tube was utilized, enclosing a high efficiency circuit that allows the sight to be turned on and left on for up to three years using a single battery. 
The front lens utilizes a unique band-pass coating, which allows the sight to be used with all generations of night vision devices. The modular QRP2 mount includes a removable spacer that indexes the sight at the optimal height for co-witness with the standard iron sights on AR15/M16/M4 Carbine style weapons. This spacer can be removed to enable the use of the sight on police shotguns or sub-machineguns. The QRP2 mount also incorporates a torque-limiting twist knob that provides the optimal level of pressure on the rail while completely eliminating the possibility of over-tightening. Both the front and rear lenses are recessed within the sight body to provide protection against impact damage, scratches, and fingerprints. 
Flip covers are included to further protect the lenses, and a transparent rear lens cover is utilized allowing the user to engage a target with the lens covers closed in an emergency situation. title: For Sale:  Taurus 9mm PT911 Lightweight Compact Beretta 92 Vertec type 16 Shot Rail 2 Magazines PT-911 191104115
postcontent: Our # HG191104115 This listing is for one pistol; FFLs, Law Enforcement, and collectors, however, may take any number of extras, subject to our stock on hand, at the same per-pistol price and with no additional shipping charges. The PT-911 shows Taurus innovation and German influence at the same time. Taurus took its Beretta Compact type frame and installed a shorter, sturdier slide with looks akin to the German Sig Pistols. Here is Taurus’s PT-911 in blue steel and black anodized finish, with a straighter, thinner grip frame on the order of Beretta’s Vertec frames for shooters more comfortable with a pared-down grip frame compared to the relatively fat feeling 92 variants. Manufacturer is Forjas Taurus of Porto Alegre Brazil, and Importer is Taurus International of Miami. Type is compact traditional double and single action semi-automatic; construction is steel barrel, slide and parts mounted on a matte finished alloy frame; grip frame is traditional and serrated fore and aft. Height is 4 15/16 inches from the top of the rear sight to the bottom of the magazine floorplate; and 6 15/16 inches from the muzzle to the end of the grip frame strut. Minimum frame thickness is .740, with a maximum slide thickness of 1.07 inches. Frame is equipped with an integral Picatinny or Weaver type rail for optical, laser and light accessories. Magazine capacity is 15 rounds, 15+1 total capacity. Barrel length is 4 inches according to the box label, but 3 3/4 inches by our own measurement. This pistol comes furnished with two blue steel finger rest floorplate Taurus factory magazines; and any Taurus 92/99 magazine will fit into this pistol with some protrusion. Ambidextrous Frame Mounted Safety levers also serve as decockers, to safely return the hammer to its resting, double-action-ready position. The pistol, like all Tauruses with frame mounted safeties, is also capable of cocked-and-locked, single-action-first-shot carry. Current replacement pricing on the PT 911 is upwards of $500 per unit in our area, if a person can even find one. We’re offering the PT-911 in the photos, however, or one of its identical mates, for only $ 349.00. Not transferable to civilian residents of California, District of Colombia, or Massachusetts. For civilian buyers in jurisdictions where 15 round magazines are restricted to Law Enforcement, we will sub One Factory Taurus PT-911 Ten Rounder for the two 15s, or $25 off with no magazines, buyer’s call. Affected jurisdictions include Connecticut, Hawaii, Maryland, and New York. Shipping. $15 lower 48; $40 Alaska, Hawaii or Puerto Rico, USPS Priority Mail, insured with Delivery Confirmation. Don’t let your buddies use your account, that kind of thing smells like felony level straw purchase attempt. GA Pay / MC/Visa/Discover/USPS MO paid orders shipped ASAP. 7 day extra hold on checks. FFL ok by fax, e-mail or mail, please ask your dealer to put your name and Gun Brand on there. We offer 7 day money back on used guns and items, but No Returns on New in Box guns or on Lay-aways or ammo. We do not pay transfer fees or return shipping. We accept lay-away with 20% down, balance in 90 days, lay aways not refundable. Internet phone hours 8:30 – 4:30 CST Mon - Fri CST. Local pickup available. Robertson Trading Post 117 Front Street PO Box 365 Henderson, Tennessee 38340 We Buy, Sell, or Trade. We always have, since 1952.

title: For Sale:  Ruger 9mm SR9 Stainless & Polymer 18 Shot 2 Magazines 3301 SR-9
postcontent: Our # HG03301 Ruger came a little late to the polymer framed handgun market, but they got it right. Here is Ruger’s slickest made 9mm pistol ever, the service size variant of the SR-9 series. Manufacturer is Sturm, Ruger & Co., Prescott Arizona plant. Type is striker fired semi automatic pistol. Construction is stainless steel slide and barrel, and steel internal parts assembled into a glass filled, steel reinforced polymer frame. Chambering is 9mm Luger, 9mm Parabellum, 9x19, call it what you will, THE 9mm. Unlike its chief competitor Glock 19, the Ruger follows its heritage and will fire any ammunition from steel case Russian to lead bullet reloads to +P Cor-bons. Barrel is 4.1 inch stainless, right hand six groove 1:10 conventional rifling. Slide is brushed, serated laterals, matte upper stainless. Sight system is dovetailed front and rear; dot front with low profile combat rear that is windage and elevation adjustable without compromising its low profile. Frame incorporates a single slot picatinny rail system for light mounting; and its mainspring housing / backstrap is reversible to change the grip contour. This pistol comes with a total of two magazines and loading tool. Both magazines are steel bodied, with steel springs, polymer cartridge followers, and flush fit flat floorplates. Each magazine holds 17 rounds of 9mm ammunition, so 17+1 fully loaded capacity. Safety system is low profile ambidextrous frame mounted lever type, with a much lower profile than its only competitor, Smith & Wesson’s M&P 9 safety variant. Extractor doubles as a loaded chamber indicator, and the trigger bar lock, Firing pin safety, and trigger safety round out the safety system. Trigger is .350 polymer with center lever, pulls at a smooth 5 pound vicinity with 1 inch of travel. The Ruger SR9, writes the factory, is sized to be comfortable and controllable with a slim, ergonomic grip and a narrow slide. The structurally rigid, recoil-reducing, glass-filled nylon frame and alloy or stainless steel slide combine to create a low-maintenance, rugged, and reliable handgun. The SR9 features a modern blocker, trigger safety, magazine disconnect, and a visual and tactile loaded chamber indicator. In addition, the SR9 has a unique reversible backstrap (flat or arched), an adjustable 3-dot sight system, an ambidextrous 1911-style manual safety and magazine release, and a built-in Picatinny rail. The SR9 weighs in at 26.5 oz. Overall length is 7.5 inches from the muzzle to the end of the grip frame butt; height is 5.5 inches from the top of the rear sight to the bottom of the magazine floorplate. Thickness is only 1.27 inches across the safety levers. Each SR9 comes in its factory hard shell case with instruction manual, NRA Membership application, factory registration card, protective papers, massive padlock, magazine loading tool, and total of two (2) factory magazines. title: For Sale:  Ruger 9mm SR9 Compact SR-9C NIB Stainless & Polymer 18 Shot 2 Magazines 3313 SR9C
postcontent: Our # HG03313 Ruger came a little late to the polymer framed handgun market, but they got it right. Here is Ruger’s slickest made 9mm pistol ever, the Compact variant of the SR-9 series. Manufacturer is Sturm, Ruger & Co., Prescott Arizona plant. Type is striker fired semi automatic pistol. Construction is stainless steel slide and barrel, and steel internal parts assembled into a glass filled, steel reinforced polymer frame. Chambering is 9mm Luger, 9mm Parabellum, 9x19, call it what you will, THE 9mm. Unlike its chief competitor Glock 19, the Ruger follows its heritage and will fire any ammunition from steel case Russian to lead bullet reloads to +P Cor-bons. Barrel is 3.4 inch stainless, right hand six groove 1:10 conventional rifling. Slide is brushed, serated laterals, matte upper stainless. Sight system is dovetailed front and rear; dot front with low profile combat rear that is windage and elevation adjustable without compromising its low profile. Frame incorporates a single slot picatinny rail system for light mounting; and its mainspring housing / backstrap is reversible to change the grip contour. This pistol comes with a total of two magazines and loading tool. The main magazine is a 10 rounder flush fit with interchangeable flat plate and finger rest floorplates. Secondary magazine is a full bodied SR9 17 rounder with sleeve adapter to anchor it to the SR9C’s grip frame butt. Safety system is low profile ambidextrous frame mounted lever type, with a much lower profile than its only competitor, Smith & Wesson’s M&P 9C safety variant. Extractor doubles as a loaded chamber indicator, and the trigger bar lock, Firing pin safety, and trigger safety round out the safety system. Trigger is .350 polymer with center lever, pulls at a smooth 5 pound vicinity with 1 inch of travel. The SR9C compact pistol, writes the Factory, weighs in at 23.40 oz. and features an overall length of 6.85 inches, a height of 4.61 inches with short magazine, and the same slim 1.27 inch grip width (across safety levers) as the full-sized SR9. Replacement pricing on this pistol is upwards of $500 in our area, if a person can even find one. We’re offering the SR-9C in the photos, however, or one of its identical mates for only $ 389.00. title: For Sale:  Ruger .22 Magnum Single Nine KNR69M 6 1/2 inch Stainless 9 Shot Fiber Optic Adjustable Sights 22 Winchester Magnum Only New In Box 08150
postcontent: Our # HG08150 Too big, some will say, we want a little pocket revolver in .22 Magnum. Try one of those little guns, though, before you buy it, and make sure you'll be able to actually pull its trigger for starters. Then try to hit something with it. This is a vastly better handgun for most purposes. All of us love and respect the Ruger Single Six revolvers. The Convertibles, however, cannot produce accuracy with Long Rifle ammunition. Not so, however, with the Winchester Magnum Round. The Convertible Single Sixes have always been bored correctly for the larger diameter bullet that the magnum carries, and a good many of us noticed the superb accuracy years ago. Here, then, is Ruger’s new KNR69M, the Stainless Single Nine. Manufacturer is Sturm Ruger of Newport, New Hampshire. Construction is entirely stainless steel, only with black anodized, bifocal friendly green fiber optic dot, windage and elevation adjustable rear sights, and matching screw-on ramp front sight. Barrel is 6 1/2 inch, 1:14 twist. Grips are factory Ruger laminate wood. Type is Single Action Only Revolver with transfer bar safety mechanism. Hammer is .290 serrated spur stainless, with .300 smooth faced trigger. Capacity is 9 rounds of .22 Winchester Magnum ammunition. Weight empty is 39 ounces, with center of gravity at the front trigger guard junction. Each Single Nine comes in its factory box with all its papers, massive Ruger padlock, and fired brass envelope. Photo specimen’s trigger gauged at 4 1/2 pounds with minimal felt creep. title: For Sale:  Taurus .357 Magnum Model 66 Stainless 4 inch Full Lug Heavy Barrel 7 Shot 357 Mag model M66 NIB #2660049 S&W 686 ty
postcontent: Our # HG2660049 Here is the Brazilian Descendant to, and refinement of, the Smith & Wesson Distinguished Combat Magnum. This is the Taurus Model 66, product code # 2-660049. Its 7 round capacity was as much an influence on the parent Smith & Wesson as an effect from Smith. Sights are classic Red Ramp front and adjustable White outline rear. More traditional than the 686, the Taurus's barrel lug has a nice smart bevel that brings its styling closer to the Smith & Wesson 66. Satin Stainless .385 Hammer and smooth combat trigger are both closer to classic 1970s S&W configuration, and the patented Taurus internal lock is the least conspicuous of its kind on any revolver. Weight empty is a superbly balanced 39 1/2 ounces. Grips are factory Taurus Combat grips, superior in fit, function, and recoil absorption to the Michaels grips that are standard issue on many S&Ws. Caliber is .38 Special and .357 Magnum interchangeably. With the Smith & Wessons commanding prices well above $700.00 apiece, this Taurus 66 Stainless 4 inch full lug 7 shot model 66 is an exceptional value at only $ 519.00.
